isis.stitle: TSI 96-08-08 - Operation and Adjustment of the New Design Stop Light/Brake Booster Switch

subjectgroup.subject: Operation and Adjustment of the New Design Stop Light/Brake Booster Switch

geninfo.para: This TSI applies to 3600, 3800, 4700 and 4900 models with hydraulic brakes.

Effective May 15, 1995, 4700 and 4900 Models and effective August 5, 1996, 3600 and 3800 Models use a new design switch to control the stop light and brake booster function. The new switch design replaced the individual stop light and brake booster switches.

item.para: With Ignition Off and Brake Pedal Not Applied
Brake booster pump must be Off
With Ignition Off and Brake Pedal Applied (light pressure)
With Ignition On, Engine Not Running and Brake Pedal Not Applied
Stop lights must Not be On
Brake booster pump must Run with warning lamp and buzzer On
With Engine Running and Brake Pedal Not Applied
Stop lights must Not be On
Brake booster pump, warning lamp and buzzer must Not be On
With Engine Running and Brake Pedal Applied
Brake booster pump, warning lamp and buzzer must Not be On unless there is a fault in the brake or power steering hydraulic system

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE
svcproc.para: If the brake system does not operate as described, the stop light/brake booster switch may be out of adjustment.

To adjust the switch, push down on the brake pedal and hold the pedal down. With the pedal down, pull the plunger out of the switch about 1 inch toward the brake pedal ( Figure 1). Slowly release the brake pedal and the switch will self adjust. Make sure that the switch cannot rotate and is held in place by the tab on the switch bracket. If the switch rotates, bend the tab as required to lock the switch in position.

note.para: Do not pull the brake pedal up by hand. Doing so could misadjust the switch.

svcproc.para: Also check to see if brake pedal moves down slightly when the engine is started. If it does, there is a problem with the power steering fluid flow system. Refer to the appropriate power steering manual for diagnostic information. If this condition exists, the stop switch cannot be properly adjusted until the power steering system is repaired.

When adjusting the stop light switch by pulling out the plunger, the plunger should take 7 to 20 pounds of force to pull the plunger out. If the force to pull out the plunger is below 7 pounds, replace the switch.
